header_summary:
Gloria Zhao announced the availability of Bitcoin Core version 29.2rc2 for testing, highlighting its significance in the software's development cycle and encouraging community feedback to ensure its stability before the final release. This version, along with detailed release notes and source code, can be accessed on the [Bitcoin Core website](https://bitcoincore.org/bin/bitcoin-core-29.2/test.rc2/) and its [GitHub repository](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/tree/v29.2rc2), marking an important step towards enhancing the Bitcoin platform.

Fanquake introduced Bitcoin Core version 30.0rc3, emphasizing the community's role in testing and providing feedback. This release candidate, available for download on the [official website](https://bitcoincore.org/bin/bitcoin-core-30.0/test.rc3), includes comprehensive release notes and a testing guide to assist contributors in evaluating the software thoroughly before its final version is released.

Ismaelsadeeq and Guardian discussed significant advancements in Bitcoin Core's functionality and security. The introduction of the `waitnext()` RPC in version 30.0 offers a more efficient block template selection process for miners, with detailed information available on [delvingbitcoin.org](https://delvingbitcoin.org). Meanwhile, the Bitcoin Guard project aims to enhance user security by implementing technical measures against physical attacks on Bitcoin owners, offering solutions through a lightweight signaling protocol within Bitcoin addresses, detailed on [delvingbitcoin.org](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/introducing-bitcoin-guard/2049) and its [GitHub repository](https://github.com/bitcoinguardian/electrum).

These discussions encapsulate the ongoing efforts to refine, secure, and improve Bitcoin Core and the broader ecosystem, demonstrating a collaborative approach to addressing both technical challenges and security concerns within the community.

recent_posts.title: Bitcoin Core 29.2 Release Candidate 2 Available
recent_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin Core version 29.2rc2 is now available for testing.
- Interested parties can review or contribute to its source code on GitHub.
- This release candidate marks an essential phase before becoming the official v29.2 release.

recent_posts.title: Bitcoin Core 30.0rc3 release candidate is available
recent_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin Core's latest release candidate, v30.0rc3, is now ready for testing and review.
- Source code and binaries are available on their official website and GitHub repository, respectively.
- This version aims to enhance stability before the official launch, with comprehensive notes and a testing guide provided.

recent_posts.title: Determining BlockTemplate Fee Increase Using Fee Rate Diagram
recent_posts.summary:
- The `waitnext()` RPC in Bitcoin Core v30 optimizes miners' block template selection.
- Cluster Mempool improves efficiency by adjusting block templates to fee changes without full rebuilds.
- A new Block Template Manager handles updates asynchronously, enhancing transaction processing.

recent_posts.title: Introducing Bitcoin Guard
recent_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin Guard aims to enhance Bitcoin security by deterring attackers with increased risk.
- It includes a signaling protocol for wallet locking and offers both desktop and mobile applications.
- The project's effectiveness is confirmed via an Electrum fork, with technical details available online.

recent_posts.title: Bitcoin Core v30.0 Released
recent_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin Core version v30.0 brings updates, new features, and bug fixes.
- It ends maintenance for versions 27.x and older, recommending users to upgrade.
- Notable changes include a new bitcoin command line tool and improved wallet and GUI functionalities.

active_posts.title: [BIP Proposal] Limit ScriptPubkey Size >= 520 Bytes Consensus.
authors: [BIP Proposal] Limit ScriptPubkey Size >= 520 Bytes Consensus PortlandHODL
active_posts.summary:
- Brandon Black proposes a Bitcoin soft fork to invalidate large ScriptPubkeys after a certain height.
- The fork, based on BIP 0002 data, targets rarely used outpoints to improve network security and efficiency.
- It addresses scalability, aims for consensus-policy alignment, but anticipates concerns over future technological needs.

active_posts.title: On (in)ability to embed data into Schnorr
authors: On (in)ability to embed data into Schnorr waxwing/ AdamISZ
active_posts.summary:
- AdamISZ investigates embedding data in Schnorr signatures, questioning its security implications.
- He concludes data embedding compromises the private key, challenging existing cryptographic practices.
- AdamISZ encourages discussions on his findings, available on GitHub for further exploration.

active_posts.title: Bitcoin Core v30.0 Released
active_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin Core 30.0 introduces new features, bug fixes, and enhanced performance.
- Upgrades necessitate shutting down older versions, supporting direct transitions from EOL versions.
- Major updates include policy changes, network enhancements, and significant wallet improvements.

active_posts.title: Sharing block templates
active_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin nodes and miners are adopting new mempool policies like full replace-by-fee and enhanced spam filtering.
- Compact block relay has significantly improved block propagation times and reduced orphan rates.
- Strategies like weak blocks and template sharing are being explored to optimize network efficiency and security.

active_posts.title: Response to Pieter Wuille's StackExchange Answer Re: Nuking the Opreturn Filter
active_posts.summary:
- The Bitcoin fee estimation process is complex and uncertain due to miner unpredictability.
- Efforts to standardize mempools to predict miner actions are seen as futile and risky.
- A shift towards broader network-wide heuristics for fee estimation is advocated.

active_posts.title: Eclipsing Bitcoin Nodes with BGP Interception Attacks
active_posts.summary:
- A stealthier BGP hijacking exposes Bitcoin network's vulnerability to eclipse attacks.
- An attacker can hijack Bitcoin traffic by manipulating BGP routes, enabling potential abuses.
- Proposed mitigations include rotating peers, dynamic port negotiation, and enhancing route awareness in Bitcoin Core.

today_in_history_posts.title: Reorgs on SigNet - Looking for feedback on approach and parameters
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Signet aims to provide a stable Bitcoin test environment, discussed by Anthony Towns and Matt Corallo.
- Corallo highlighted using signet for integration testing and its advantages over regtest for internet use without major reorgs.
- It was concluded signet is ideal as a "demo mainnet" for testing software behavior with mainnet-like constraints.
contributors: [bitcoin-dev] Reorgs on SigNet - Looking for feedback on approach and parameters 0xB10C

today_in_history_posts.title: In-protocol liquidity probing and channel jamming mitigation
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Lightning wallets probe routes to find fees, locking up liquidity temporarily.
- A new protocol message proposal aims to ease liquidity without updating channels.
- Solutions for channel jamming include charging attackers, but may harm user experience.

today_in_history_posts.title: Thoughts on scaling and consensus changes (2023)
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin scaling aims for 50,000 off-chain "bitcoin banks" to handle most transactions.
- Concepts like Utreexo aim to optimize storage and validation without solving all issues.
- Hybrid systems and Layer 2 protocols are crucial for scalability and security enhancements.
